author: heinz.gassner
title: DLT360: Agriculture and Metaverse
description: Agricultural communities and initiatives are not yet sufficiently aware of the disruptive potential of DLT/Blockchain, WEB 3.0 and Metaverse

f6_assessments.q0:
NOTE for VCAs and voters: This proposal is part of a wider project (DLT360) that has at least 13 proposals in this funding round. This proposal is judged partly through its individual merits, and partly through the way it fits into the wider DLT360 project. My assessment takes into account aspects common across all proposals (team specific like adequacy, competency, workload, or similar reporting mechanisms / budget logic). You shall therefore find common parts across these proposals (labeled as such) and parts specific to each proposal, which should offer a good balance of looking at each tree but not missing out the overall health of the forest. 

Specific part: DLT360 is working in close proximity with NGOs, University of Malta and interesting initiatives in the Permaculture segment, promoting decentralized organic farming in difficult regions. This proposal would support the ongoing project to continue with selected initiatives in Malta, Italy and Austria and to integrate the findings in the form of Whitepaper.
f6_assessments.q1:
COMMON part: Great team. DLT360 is operated by an outstanding and growing team of regulatory experts, very active in the Cardano community. They also benefit from a scalable network of contributors from the Cardano community, academia, industry and EU institutions. In terms of team competence, skills and experience, they are well positioned.The multitude of projects funded under their umbrella showcases the great capacity to identify opportunities within the Cardano community and clearly articulate them into actionable projects. 

COMMON part: Significant existing and future workload. DLT360 is a wider project initially funded in Fund6, and greatly supported by at least 5 proposals in Fund7, for a total funding so far of 85.000 USD (own calculations), many of them being still ongoing. During Fund8 the team is casting a very wide net with 13 additional proposals across several challenges, for a total funding of 295.000 USD. Onboarding so many projects so quickly can potentially lead to: too much workload, overlapping deadlines, increased risks of under-delivering, inability to distinguish added value of one project versus another, unnecessary stress and a lack of focus on and core scope and competencies. Future iterations that can bring comfort to these worries will of course be highly appreciated. 

COMMON part: ALL of the 13 projects have overhead items included in the budget (project management, social media, back office, etc.) consuming an overall 30-40% of each budget (an educated guess let’s call it). I think there was a missed opportunity there in terms of gathering all overheads under one roof and simplifying the budgets for all proposals by keeping them strict for core-activities.

Specific part: project would comprise basic research by senior & junior contributors and various meetings & discussions including travel.  For budget core-work rates are 80 USD/hour. Core research + meetings take up 60% of the budget.
f6_assessments.q2:
COMMON part: Existing track record. DLT360 projects are interlinked and since there are a number of running projects the team is definitely familiarized with the standard procedures and reporting process of the Catalyst team, so there are very low risks in terms of failing to communicate properly or inability to implement the necessary KPIs. 

COMMON part: The website is a great opportunity for improvement. A concern is the fact that glancing at the DLT360 website, there is no reflection of recent live presentations that were perhaps delivered to the community in Q1 2022. I am aware that it is a work in progress tool, and a very nice-to-have feature would be for such live presentations / slides / supporting materials to be uploaded there as soon as possible and be accessible for the community as an intermediate deliverable until the projects are finalized. Also for the sake of transparency, a user-friendly list of funded (any why not unfunded) proposals would definitely be appreciated, at least by future CAs.   

Specific part: project - specific KPIs are inserted. They include project-specific network growth, no. of NGO partnerships, Whitepaper published.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the problem of competitiveness of small-scale farmers, especially in Europe.  It addresses this challenge by providing opportunities to small-scale farmers to compete globally and become a significant player in EU market. This proposal provides the workshop and goals, which is to educate the farmers in Malta or Italy. By having these workshops, Cardano will be exposed widely in the community of farmers and their consumers.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal provides a well-thought-out plan on how to implement and run these workshops. The budget has been broken down into details (activities, hours, number of people involved, etc.), which proven the ability of the proposer to identify the type of team members needed, as well as what resources are needed. This proposal is a continuation of the funded- project in Fund 6 and fund 7, therefore it is proven that this team and the project were solid. furthermore, the laid out 4months plan is well explained and reasonable.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provides a clear 4 monthly roadmap with their goals and expected results. To achieve those goals, this proposal provides 6 key activities along with the outcomes of each activity. This proves that the proposer knows what the problems and the solutions are. Furthermore, there are 4 KPIs in this proposal and the team has added feasible outcomes such as having > 3 regular contributors, >5 NGO,s and cooperation with some cities in Europe.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal has clearly outlined a problem statement, and related solution. The creation of a well researched whitepaper outlining the strategies for sustainable approaches & business models within agriculture and blockchain, will help the Cardano ecosystem broaden it's reach and provide real world utility.  While I acknowledge that a whitepaper is not the same as real world utility, I do believe it is a pre-requisite to achieving the goals of a more sustainably managed agriculture industry. I believe the current ongoing work and the connections DLT360 has will provide significant impact on the Cardano ecosystem and adoption by many small and large organizations and governments. The proposal states the team is "working in close proximity with NGOs, University of Malta and with interesting initiatives in the Permaculture segment, promoting decentralized organic farming in difficult regions (concretely: Malta, Italy and European Alps)." Therefore I believe the potential impact of this project will be significant both for Cardano and blockchain adoption, but also for global environmental sustainability initiatives.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal has a high rating for feasibility, as rated by the ability of the team to deliver on the specific activities listed below:
"This project requires the following specific key-activities - all during Q3 / 2022:
Participation in the 2-weekly meetings of DLT360 Economy/Business & Environmental Teams
Basic research by 1 senior domain expert & junior contributors
Active efforts to integrate other projects and cooperation-partners
Writing of the summarising Whitepaper
Supporting of RADAR integration of this paper and all important links
Supporting the integration into the DLT360 quarterly reporting
Active role in sharing/discussing the content during the current quarter"
It should be noted that the proposal discusses many broad concepts and value propositions that go well beyond the specific deliverables of this funding proposal. While they are relevant and important to the overall vision, this feasibility rating is based on only the specific deliverables as defined in the proposal. 
The budget is clearly outlined and broken down into tasks, the number of hours required for each task, and hourly compensation required. The plan includes a clear roadmap and specific timeline for delivery. The team has provided the specific resources required for implementation, and a realistic assessment and mitigation strategy for the risks inherent in this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal recieves 5 stars for Clarity and Auditability because the team has provided specific and auditable KPI's as well as a timeline, as listed below:
"Our Definition of Done and our success criteria by end of Q3 of 2022 are derived from the above listed KPI measurement:
We have grown our Agriculture-related contributor-network (> 3 regular contributors)
We have established active NGO partnerships (> 5)
Cooperation with major public entities (EU, Malta, Italy, Austria: >5)
We have achieved all our activities & deliverables as listed above (100%)
We have created, quality checked and released the Whitepaper & a new RADAR content element (100%)"

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a fantastic proposal that focuses on summarising detailed research in a comprehensive Whitepaper, showing strategies for sustainable approaches & business models.
Regarding impact, some issues that should be noted as following:
Firstly, the proposer defines a suitable problem within the challenge which needs to be solved, explains it in detail with rationale. They [DLT360] demonstrates a certain deeply understanding of the field they are disscussing. The problem raised shows the authenticity and urgency to be solved in order to achieve the goals of the challenge in particular and the entire ecosystem in general. In addition, the proposed solution is clearly defined. It shows the possibility of adding value to the Cardano ecosystem with clear expected impact in short term and long term. Besides, the proposer also define the possibility of scaling to address future challenges.
In conclusion, I strongly agree on the impact of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
Regarding feasibility, there are some issues that should be noted, including:
First of all, this team profile is provided and described enough for understanding show suitable skill, experiences for implementation, with reference/proof (documents/links,...) for verifying. In addition, as I know, this team/proposer has a proposal funded in the prior fund. This proposal's goal is clear and realistic supported by reasons, along with a specific roadmap, some logical, measurable KPIs/metrics, and a budget breakdown for assessing the detail of the implementation process. Finally, the risk is clearly defined with some mitigation as well as some further explanation of how performance that mitigation would be; This shows that the proposer has fully looked and realistic vision of what could happen during the implementation of this proposal.
Therefore, based on the provided information, I strongly agree with this proposal's feasibility
f6_assessments.q2:
Regarding this proposal's auditability, there are some issues that should be noted, including:
First of all, as can be seen, this team profile is provided and described enough for understanding, with reference/proof (documents/links,...) for verifying. Secondly, the roadmap is provided and clearly described. For measuring the success of this proposal, the proposer(s) choose some measurable KPI/metrics, including: KPI 1 - Size of Agriculture-related content-contributor network (number); KPI 2 - Number of involved NGO and governmental partners (number),... This proposal's budget has provided with clear cost items structure and understandable explanations of calculation base [number of employees, number of working hours, labor price,...].
Based on the provided information, I strongly agree with this proposal's auditability

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer team has established contact with some small-scale farming communities, and identified potential innovative models for the sustainability of that industry using blockchain. With that starting point, the proposers plan to continue researching using a framework they are using in several other industries. Altough the challenge brief has a more practical tone, I think this research could be considered to be aligned. Impact on Cardano is long-term, in the best-case scenario, and difficult to quantify, but raising awareness of blockchain technology in this specific industry should have a positive impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
Project plan is detailed, albeit not specific for this proposal, as the team presents a great number of similar proposals. The core team should be experienced in this kind of work, but potentially thinly spread with the amount of proposals they're involved in. For this particular proposal, no domain expert is identified in the proposal. 
The team relies on unidentified university assistants and students (from 5 universities).  With that in mind, the hourly rates seem quite high ($80/h vs a mean hourly salary for researchers in the countries mentioned in the proposal between $10/h in Brazil to $35/h in Austria, according to salaryexpert).
f6_assessments.q2:
Metrics  are appropriate for the kind of work being done, measuring scientific production. They also propose to consider the number of partnerships with NGOs and governments, with the ambitious goal of establishing a cooperation with five of each.
Proposer is experienced in the Catalyst process, and already knows what is expected of them.
